analysisEngineMetaData.name: de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.treetagger.TreeTaggerChunker
analysisEngineMetaData.copyright: Copyright 2010-2015 Ubiquitous Knowledge Processing (UKP) Lab Technische Universit√§t Darmstadt

configurationParameter.name: language
configurationParameter.description: Use this language instead of the document language to resolve the model.

configurationParameter.name: modelVariant
configurationParameter.description: Override the default variant used to locate the model.

configurationParameter.name: executablePath
configurationParameter.description: Use this TreeTagger executable instead of trying to locate the executable automatically.

configurationParameter.name: modelLocation
configurationParameter.description: Load the model from this location instead of locating the model automatically.

configurationParameter.name: ChunkMappingLocation
configurationParameter.description: Location of the mapping file for chunk tags to UIMA types.

configurationParameter.name: internTags
configurationParameter.description:
Use the String#intern() method on tags. This is usually a good idea to avoid spaming the heap with thousands of strings representing only a few different tags.
Default: true

configurationParameter.name: printTagSet
configurationParameter.description:
Log the tag set(s) when a model is loaded.
Default: false

configurationParameter.name: performanceMode
configurationParameter.description: TT4J setting: Disable some sanity checks, e.g. whether tokens contain line breaks (which is not allowed). Turning this on will increase your performance, but the wrapper may throw exceptions if illegal data is provided.

configurationParameter.name: flushSequence
configurationParameter.description: A sequence to flush the internal TreeTagger buffer and to force it to output the rest of the completed analysis. This is typically just a sequence of like 5-10 full stops (".") separated by new line characters. However, some models may require a different flush sequence, e.g. a short sentence in the respective language. For chunker models, mind that the sentence must also be POS tagged, e.g. Nous-PRO:PER\n....
